pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:4.1: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were walking in inhabited areas, playing with their hands and feet. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:7.1: “‘I will walk well-restrained in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:8.1: Walking in an inhabited area, one should be well-restrained.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:8.2: If a monk, out of disrespect, walks in an inhabited area, playing with his hands and feet, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:10.1: The fifth training rule is finished.
